about_the_game:
Baugarten - Experience the power of Science

In a post-apocalyptic world, the knowledge that allowed humans to thrive has been lost. Re-build civilization and experience how using scientific principles can accelerate progress.

In Baugarten, empire building seamlessly integrates with scientific concepts. Put them at the core of your empire's success, or try thriving without them. The game offers a single, dynamic experience whether you feel like using your brain - or not. 

Key Features:

Empire-Building

In Baugarten, you build your own empire. You build production sites, infrastructure, supply chains, housing. You trade with others, you take care of your population, explore new regions, struggle against the environment. Resources are scarce and you need to make sure, you don't waste them to thrive. Keep everything optimised and you will succeed. 

Varied Building Types

Customize a range of structures, each with unique mathematical and scientific attributes. Develop efficient farms, construct intricate factories, and create elaborate trade routes or opt for simpler approaches.

Balance short term needs with long-term strategy

As your society develops, you will need to balance short term needs of your population with the large resource intensive investments in infrastructure that will help you thrive in the long run. How will you allocate your scarce resources? 

Integrated Scientific Elements

Baugarten weaves scientific concepts seamlessly into empire-building gameplay. Science helps you decide what size your farms should be, what crops to plant, how to optimise the infrastructure that connects your production sites etc.

Optional Science Use

Baugarten is not a learning game. It is a real PC game that happens to make some of the scientific principles that underpin our world explicit. As a player, you have the freedom to choose whether you will apply scientific principles or not. You can opt to use math and science to maximise your empire's efficiency or simply focus on empire building without it. 

The beauty of optimisation

All games with simulation elements are underpinned by hidden mechanics about how the world works. These can only ever be manipulated by trial and error. At times, this can be frustrating, as with increasing complexity, it is impossible to know, whether your empire is still optimised. In Baugarten, you can go the extra step and use math and science - to make sure you scratch that itch of having run everything at 100% performance. 

Educational Gameplay

Baugarten is designed first to entertain and then to educate. Explore the practical applications of scientific concepts in a dynamic virtual world to enhance your empire building and strategy.

Beautiful World to Explore

Immerse yourself in a visually stunning world, full of diverse landscapes and cultures. Roam the map and discover the wonders of your ever-expanding empire, regardless of your chosen approach.

If you are intrigued, you can download an early prototype from our web-site (. We are  also currently making a new one to be released in the coming months.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS *: Windows 7 (64-bit) or later
  • Processor: Intel Core i3-2100 or equivalent
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Integrated graphics or a dedicated graphics card with at least 1GB VRAM, such as Intel HD Graphics 3000 or NVIDIA GeForce 600 series
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
  • Sound Card: DirectX compatible

short_description: Baugarten is a new kind of empire-builder. Baugarten plays like a traditional empire builder - but those interested can push the limit by leveraging their math and science skills to optimise everything further and get ahead faster.
supported_languages:
English*, French*, German*
*languages with full audio support
